{"step_by_step_thinking": "ASOM stands for Acute Suppurative Otitis Media, which is a common ear infection in children. The most common organisms causing ASOM are Streptococcus pneumoniae (Pneumococcus), Haemophilus influenzae, and Moraxella catarrhalis. Among these, Pneumococcus and H. influenzae are the most common. Staphylococcus is less commonly involved in ASOM, and Streptococcus here is too broad a term as it includes many species, not all of which are commonly involved in ASOM.", "answer_choice": "A. Pneumococcus"}
